description.narrative: Support for Community Services ("Community Services Activity"): The Community Services Activity is designed to complement the Agriculture Project by providing educational, water and sanitation and rural electrification infrastructure in the Intervention Zones and by enhancing the capacity of local governments to deliver the related services. MCC Funding will support the following: (i) Capacity building by the Ministry of Local Government and Rural Development for the local government units in the Intervention Zones to strengthen their ability to deliver community services, to manage assets and to ensure transparency and accountability in their operations. (ii) Rehabilitation and construction of educational facilities in the form of primary, junior secondary and senior secondary schools, as well as vocational and technical institutions. (iii) Construction of water and sanitation facilities to achieve improved health, to reduce the incidence of illness and loss of productivity due to unsafe drinking water and poor sanitation and hygiene, and to reduce the time required to procure potable water. (iv) Expansion of rural electrification to unserved and underserved areas which may include for domestic uses as well as for use in irrigation, agricultural processing and education.

condition.narrative: Prior to any MCC Disbursement for any of the sub-activities described in Sections 2(b)(ii), (iii) or (iv) of Schedule 3 to Annex I of the Compact: MiDA has submitted the following, each satisfactory to MCC: i) Service norms & standard designs: Norms for the provision of services and facilities, and standard designs of facilities to be built or rehabilitated, in accordance with the relevant ministries, departments and agencies; ii) District planning processes: Defined processes of prioritizing and selecting projects to be funded in accordance with District Development Plans, including consideration of proximity to the Project Activities under the Agriculture Project; iii) Community commitment standards: Standards for minimum contribution in cash or other property (including land and raw material) or labor by communities to qualify for participation; iv) Operating and maintenance budget commitments: Standards for adequate commitment of provision for operating and maintenance budgets, including needed staffing commitments; and standards for adequate cost recovery mechanisms (as appropriate); and v) Environmental and social assessment: Defined processes and standards for adequate assessment of environmental and social impacts, and remediation if needed.

Prior to any MCC Disbursement for the Community Services Activity: MiDA has selected and engaged the Community Services Project Manager, approved by MCC, or in the event the position is vacated, MiDA is actively recruiting for the position.

Prior to any MCC Disbursement for the sub-activity described in Section 2(b)(i) of Schedule 3 to Annex I of the Compact: MiDA has executed one or more Implementing Entity Agreements with (1) the Ministry of Local Government, Rural Development and Environment (for RICU), (2) the Community Water and Sanitation Entity, and (3) the Ministry of Education, Youth and Sport (for the Ghana Education Service), and these Implementing Entity Agreement(s) remain in full force and effect.

Prior to any MCC Disbursement for the sub-activity described in Section 2(b)(i) of Schedule 3 to Annex I of the Compact: MiDA has submitted a project implementation manual, completed to MCC's satisfaction, setting out key operational roles, responsibilities and processes relating to, among others (1) financial management, procurement and contracting mechanisms; (2) methodology for allocation of funds among eligible districts; (3) relationships with relevant ministries, district assemblies, area councils and other communities; and (4) reporting requirements.

(ii) Rehabilitation and construction of educational facilities in the form of primary, junior secondary and senior secondary schools, as well as vocational and technical institutions. (iii) Construction of water and sanitation facilities to achieve improved health, to reduce the incidence of illness and loss of productivity due to unsafe drinking water and poor sanitation and hygiene, and to reduce the time required to procure potable water.
